hackathon-description-text: Welcome to the Startupbootcamp Digital Health Hackathon!
hackathon-eligibility: Teams should be no larger than 4 people
hackathon-requirements: Submissions will consist of a pitch to our jury on June 11th and a meeting with the technical judge to appraise the quality and innovation of your hacks
hackathon-rules: We expect all participants to behave in a respectful manner, and abide by our

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: To the best Hack of the competition
Imagine you visit an empty or already used doc’s office for the very first time - that could be yours.
Increase the quality of life of patients
Use Amazon Alexa / Echo to create value and a positive user experience for people suffering with diabetes
Improve the workflow and satisfaction of midwives

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: How much difference the submission make in the real world, to real patients
How innovative the submission is, have you seen something that no one else could? Can you reframe a problem or bring about an unexpected solution?
How well crafted the submission is, have you been able to pull something incredible off in the short time you had available to you?
Can you inspire the judges to believe in your solution? Points will be awarded to great presentations and inspiring solutions
Does the project do what your team claim it does?
Awarded to teams that have crafted a great technical solution

hackathon-description-header: What type of legacy do you want to leave?
